result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) and Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Robert P Vesper was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration or Substance Abuse Program.
Credit for 76 days served.

AS OF 9/23/2015: Defendant is NOT entitled to the 76 days credit.
Consecutive to: any other sentence

superMiscConds.notes:
Fine to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

DNA Surcharge and Blood Draw Costs to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.
Blood draw costs will be forwarded to the City of Waukesha Police Dept.

AS OF 11/17/2015: DNA SURCHARGE TO BE WAIVED/REMOVED.
Maintain full time employment and/or schooling.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.
Mental Health and Psychological evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
Not to be present on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol. (bars, taverns, liquor stores)
Provide DNA sample if not already done.
Do not operate unless properly licensed.
Count 3 was dismissed outright.

superTimeConds.notes: To be done during Extended Supervision.

supervisions.notes: Attendance to the Victim Impact Panel Meeting to be completed while on Extended Supervision.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Robert P Vesper in court, in custody, with attorney Peter M Wolff.   Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. Ct. 2 dismissed and read-in. Ct. 3 dismissed by operation of law.

Court orders the following: 
Ct.1:
- Total sentence: 9 years 2 months (Initial Confinement: 50 months - credit for 76 days, Extended Supervision: 5 years) - consecutive to any other sentence 
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration 
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program
- 36 months Drivers License Revocation. 
- 36 months Ignition Interlock on every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to defendant
- Attendance at a Victim Impact Panel meeting while on Extended Supervision
- Alcohol Assessment
- Fine totaling: $3166.00 to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.
- Blood Test Reimbursement of $35.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forward to City of Waukesha Police Department
- Conditions of Extended Supervision: AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling. Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s..   Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No drug paraphernalia. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform Agent of all prescriptions. Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling or any other approved activity by agent. No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e. bars, taverns, or liquor stores). Mental Health and psychological evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate. No operation of a Motor Vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Defendant to provide DNA sample.
- Defendant to perform 100 hours of community service as a condition of Extended Supervision.
filed, to be produced from Dodge Correctional Institution.
Detainer placed at Dodge Correctional Institution.
